etymology.description: semantic: 离(离) (lí, "separate") + phonetic: 离(离) (lí, "separate") = separates animals -> separation
etymology.interpretation: The character 离(离) (lí, "separate") combines semantic and phonetic elements within itself to convey the idea of separation, often visually represented as two animals or parts moving apart.
etymology.simplification: 离(離): Simplified by reducing components; the traditional form features multiple complex structures that were compressed in the simplified form.

examples.chinese: 车站离这里有一段距离(車站離這裏有一段距離)。
examples.pinyin: Chēzhàn lí zhèlǐ yǒu yī duàn jùlí.
examples.english: The station is a distance away from here.

examples.chinese: 他离开家庭(他離開家庭)，去追寻自由(去追尋自由)。
examples.pinyin: Tā lí kāi jiātíng, qù zhuīxún zìyóu.
examples.english: He left his family to pursue freedom.

examples.chinese: 他们离别时(他們離別時)，泪水难以自控(淚水難以自控)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen líbié shí, lèishuǐ nányǐ zìkòng.
examples.english: When they parted, tears were uncontrollable.
